intro: Acrophorus stipellatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its fruits are pod-like structures that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
